title: BBC Local Live: Channel Islands on Thursday 19 October 2017 - BBC News
summary: jersey wayside cafe development plans rejected .
committee proposes 'immediate ' changes to guernsey population law .
some jersey groups might lose charity status under new rules .
lack of action on guernsey disability strategy criticised .
guernsey prepares for assisted dying debate .
call to drop firework-buying age in guernsey .

documents.title: our coverage across the day
text: our coverage across the channel islands has finished for the day .
we 'll be back on friday from 08:00 with the latest news , weather , travel and sport .
do n't forget bbc channel islands news on bbc one at 18:30 and 22:30 .

documents.title: weather : gales possible overnight , and rain on friday
text: it will be windy and wet to start the night , with gales possibly affecting the islands .
the rain will die away by morning , with the winds easing too .
minimum temperature : 13c ( 55f ) .
friday will see a dry and bright morning , with some sunny spells .
thickening cloud will spread rain eastwards through the afternoon .
maximum temperature : 16c ( 61f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: condor liberation services cancelled to jersey tomorrow
text: condor have cancelled liberation services to jersey tomorrow due to a `` fast approaching weather front '' .
the 12:00 poole to jersey service , the 15:30 guernsey to jersey , the 17:30 jersey to guernsey and the 17:30 jersey to poole services have all been cancelled .
the liberation would travel between poole and guernsey at 13:00 , arriving at 16:00 and return at 16:45 , arriving at 19:45 , managers said .
author: Rob England
BBC News Online

documents.title: prefet of brittany visits channel islands
text: the prefet of brittany , christophe mirmand , visited jersey today to meet with representatives from across the channel islands .
it marks the first time a prefet from brittany , the regional representative of the french prime minister and government , has visited the islands .
from jersey , mr mirmand met with senator ian gorst and senator sir philip bailhache ; and , from guernsey , deputy jonathan le tocq and deputy mary lowe .
senator bailhache said the group spoke about `` to of mutual interest '' , and deputy le tocq said it was important to strengthen `` existing relationships '' with the region .
the prefet also met jersey 's minister for home affairs to discuss policing and border control , a spokesman said .
the meeting was organised by the bureau des iles anglo normandes .
delighted to have welcome @ twitterid and sous prefecture of saint malo in jersey to discuss common issues @ twitterid @ twitterid
really positive discussions with our neighbours .
i was delighted to thank m le prefet for close working relations with our services
author: Rob England
BBC News Online

documents.title: states considering 'approach ' to discrimination law
text: the states of guernsey `` can not say '' how it will draft a planned disability discrimination law , a deputy has said .
following a statement at the states assembly meeting on the 18 october , deputy michelle le clerc has clarified her committee 's position on drafting the new legislation .
she said the committee was reviewing similar laws from six countries , some of which had separate law acts which stopped discrimination for different reasons , whereas others had a single law .
`` at this stage , i can not say which approach the committee for employment and social security will propose , '' deputy le clerc said , adding : `` we have to do the work first . ''
author: BBC Radio Guernsey

documents.title: ww2 exhibition to challenge collaboration 'ignorance '
text: dr gilly carr , the cambridge historian behind a london exhibition being launched this evening , says she hopes it will bring the little-known stories of victims of nazism in the channel islands to a wider audience .
the wiener library hosts the exhibition , which she said she hoped would dispel the `` ignorance '' she said she encountered during her research .
it centred on the perception , she said , that the islands were a `` hotbed of collaboration '' .

she said : `` this is exhibition is partly to bring to the capital the story that , actually , there were many victims of nazism in the channel islands : there were those deported , there were slave workers , there were jews .
`` their stories deserve to be better known . ''
author: Rob Byrne
BBC News Online

documents.title: gale warning issued for channel islands
text: a warning has been issued by jersey met office of imminent gales across the bay of st malo .
wind warning № 45/10 , issued at 14:51 utc , 19/10/2017 .
author: Rob England
BBC News Online

documents.title: wayside cafe development plans rejected
text: plans to demolish the wayside cafe in st brelade 's bay have been rejected by jersey 's planning committee .
developers had wanted to build a restaurant , surf shop and seven homes in its place .
the committee decided not to approve the plan because the size of development was deemed `` not suitable for the area '' , and concluded it would have a `` detrimental effect '' on neighbours .
author: Naomi Dunning
BBC Radio Jersey, Reporter

documents.title: on british soil : islanders ' stories told in exhibition
text: family members and island dignitaries will be among those attending the launch of an exhibition in london this evening telling the stories of victims of nazi persecution in the channel islands .
london 's wiener library in russell square hosts the exhibition , which is open to the public from tomorrow until 9 february 2017 .
it has been put together by cambridge academic dr gilly carr , who said the story of these people had been `` largely omitted '' from a british narrative of standing alone against nazism .
joseph gillingham ( features .
he was deported for his role in the guernsey underground news service , and , despite being released from a german prison , never made it back to the channel islands .
author: Rob Byrne
BBC News Online

documents.title: deputies abolish christmas day and good friday alcohol restrictions
text: pubs and bars will now be free to open and serve alcohol from 11am on christmas day and from noon on good friday , and throughout the whole evening .
author: Guernsey Press

documents.title: jersey met issues high tide warning for tonight
text: jersey met has issued a high tide warning for the south coast tonight , including tides of more than 11m ( 33ft ) .
the warning includes the risk of waves breaking over sea walls , which will cause problems with water and debris on roads along the south coast .
some flooding may also happen with the worst expected at about 19:13 this evening and 07:35 on friday .
we 'll have a full forecast later .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: committee proposes 'immediate ' changes to population law
text: `` immediate changes '' to guernsey 's population management law have been put forward by a states committee .
the changes come following concerns over the `` availability of labour '' for the hospitality sector .
the committee for economic development has proposed several re-writes to the law , including :
members said the changes would provide a `` more continuous and predictable '' supply of staff to the industry , and better flexibility and efficiency in the use of staff accommodation .
deputy jennifer merrett said she had been approached by `` a number of representatives acting on behalf of the hospitality sector '' , before proposing the changes with the committee .
the law came in to effect on 3 april .
author: Rob England
BBC News Online

documents.title: french converter station 'an option ' - alderney politician
text: any tidal power generated in alderney 's waters could be exported through a french , rather than island-based , converter station , a politician says .
in august , islanders protested against plans to build the station on the island as part of plans for the £ 500m france-alderney-britain ( fab ) link .
alderney 's government is negotiating with the developers of the electricity project , and has now said it wants more money and , ideally , no island converter station .
politician graham mckinley said alderney 's government would like to `` re-engage with the rte '' - the french company that originally signed an agreement with the states .
he said : `` there is still the possibility that all our tidal power could be exported through a converter station in france .
`` if they 're prepared to go back to that option , then that 's something we 'd prefer . ''

documents.title: first lessons at new les quennevais school in 2020
text: classes will start at the new les quennevais school building in st brelade in 2020 after planners approved the development today .
construction will start on fields next to la route de quennevais as soon as possible in 2018 .
the £ 45m project will be the single biggest investment in education in jersey - and the first new secondary school - in more than a decade .
education minister rod bryans said it had taken a `` great deal of work '' to get to this stage and that he was thrilled for staff , pupils and parishioners .
author: Ryan Morrison
BBC News Online

documents.title: frank falla archive launched
text: an online archive featuring the testimonies of channel islanders deported to german prisons and camps during world war two has gone live .
the frank falla archive is named after the former journalist and prison survivor who was deported for his role in the guernsey underground news service .
the archive has been compiled by a team of researchers led by cambridge historian dr gilly carr .
mr falla helped fellow prisoners write and submit to the british government in the 1960s to form the bulk of the archive , which will have profiles on 275 people when completed .
the archive currently has 75 profiles , with the remainder being written by the researchers over the next 18 months .
the archive 's launch coincides with the opening of an exhibition at london 's wiener library , which features some of the stories of victims of nazi persecution .
author: Rob Byrne
BBC News Online

documents.title: 'landmark ' court ruling has brexit implications
text: the uk should not be able to place taxes , tariffs and other controls on money flowing between jersey and itself following a 'landmark ' english court of appeal ruling , legal experts have said .
author: Jersey Evening Post

documents.title: same-sex marriage : alderney could benefit from 'pink pound '
text: alderney needs to take advantage of the `` pink pound '' now it 's government has approved same-sex marriage , says local campaigner dits preece .
mr preece said he hoped he and his partner , allen jones , would be among the first gay couples to get married in the island .
mr preece added that the financial benefits of gay marriage could be huge for alderney .
it 's opened the doors to lots more couples who would want to come to alderney , be married here and have a holiday at the same time . ''
author: BBC Radio Guernsey

documents.title: jersey to fund sanitation projects in tanzania
text: money from jersey will help improve sanitation in some poor areas of tanzania next year .
it 's one of the projects being funded by the jersey oversea aid commission .
others include schemes in lebanon and mongolia .
julian olivier , from raleigh international , which is running the programme in tanzania , said 90 % of schools in the area did n't have adequate sanitation .
author: BBC Radio Jersey

documents.title: alderney government 'will not accept ' electricity station
text: alderney 's government says it will not accept a converter station as part of the controversial £ 500m france-alderney-britain ( fab ) link .
the station would enable power from the cable to be used for the domestic energy market , and was originally proposed to be built at mannez quarry in the north of the island .
in august , more than 100 islanders gathered at the quarry to protest against the development .
in a statement , policy and finance chairman james dent said there should be `` no , or only very minor physical impact '' as part of any development .
mr dent would like a `` very substantially improved '' financial deal and no work to take place in the island during july and august .
negotiations with fab were ongoing , he said .
it 's expected the agreed deal between the government and the fab developers will then be put to a public vote .
author: BBC Radio Guernsey

documents.title: no ifs or butts for smokers in st peter port
text: smokers are being targeted in a campaign to rid town of cigarette butts - and there are warnings that after the awareness drive those still littering will face on-the-spot fines of £ 70 .
author: BBC Radio Guernsey

documents.title: patients waiting five months for ops
text: some patients in need of surgery are having to wait up to five months for their operation .
author: Guernsey Press

documents.title: how 's this for a man cave ?
text: a father and son ken and jamie built an arcade at the bottom of their garden in st brelade inspired by jamie 's childhood playing games at fort regent in jersey .
how 's this for a man cave ?
i 've been to meet the father and son who built an arcade at the bottom of the garden !
more on @ twitterid
author: Sarah Bailey
Broadcast Journalist, BBC Radio Jersey

documents.title: 'lack of man power ' to blame for disability strategy delay
text: the executive director of a guernsey disability charity says a lack of manpower is one of the problems on why progress on the states disability and inclusion strategy has stalled .
karen blanchford from the guernsey disability alliance says competing states priorities have not helped .
she said : `` for the first two and a half years it was around getting it prioritised , there was budget against it and the resource used was put onto other projects .
we 've had the same problem this year . ''
president of employment and social security , michelle le clerc , told the states yesterday there would be a further delay on publishing the disability strategy letter which was due in november .
author: BBC Radio Guernsey

documents.title: o'sullivan progresses in world championships
text: jersey 's lucy o'sullivan is through to the third round of the compound event world archery championships in mexico .
having beaten argentina 's sara sagastume donis 146-135 in the opening round , she defeated italy 's number one , marcella tonioli , 145-143 .
she faces germany 's kristina heigenhauser in the last 32 later on thursday , as well as beginning the team event .
author: Brent Pilnick
BBC Sport

documents.title: guernsey prepares for assisted dying debate
text: guernsey 's most senior politician has started drafting a proposition to enable assisted dying to be debated in the states .
deputy gavin st pier said he had been working to bring a proposal to the assembly for some time .
he said : `` to be fair , it is something i 've been giving consideration for a while and actively since the beginning of this year .
`` i have personal experience within the family of those who have experienced considerable suffering towards the end of their life , and would have wished to do something different .

`` it is a complex issue legally and morally , but , as a mature independent jurisdiction , we are capable of having that debate - irrespective of what england and wales decide to do or not to do . ''
author: BBC Radio Guernsey

documents.title: hospital lane road markings 'causing confusion '
text: hospital lane road markings 'causing confusion '

documents.title: charity examining trees in st helier
text: a tree charity is examining the condition and number of trees within the st helier ringroad .
jersey trees for life said there was currently no record of how many there were or where they are .
chairman gerard farnham said they needed the information to gauge how trees were faring and whether they needed to be moved or replaced .
he said public areas were almost finished and then volunteers would start asking people for access to their homes and properties to measure their trees as well .
author: BBC Radio Jersey

documents.title: archaeologists find stones of interest on estate site
text: a collection of stones has been unearthed by a team of uk archaeologists investigating fields in st clement earmarked for a new estate of 200 affordable homes .
author: Jersey Evening Post

documents.title: lack of action on disability strategy criticised
text: a leading guernsey rights campaigner says getting deputies to take action on the island 's disability and inclusion strategy is like `` wading through molasses '' .

the president of employment and social security , michelle le clerc , told states members her committee would not be able to bring forward a policy letter on the strategy in november as originally planned .
campaigner aindre reece-sheerin said he was furious that the strategy had been further delayed .
he said : `` i do n't think they care .
we are tired of platitudes , we are tired of words , we 're tired of work streams .
what we want is progress . ''
author: BBC Radio Guernsey

documents.title: education team celebrates approval of new school
text: the proposals for the new les quennevais secondary school building in st brelade have been approved by the planning committee .
building work is due to start next year and it is hoped classes will start in september 2020 .
a happy team as the new les quennevais school is approved !
congratulations , well done
wonderful news and so much needed and deserved our prayers , love and support are with all involved .
author: Ryan Morrison
BBC News Online

documents.title: call to drop firework-buying age in guernsey
text: the age young people can buy fireworks should be reduced to 18 to bring guernsey , in line with the uk , a local shop owner says .
currently customers must be over the age of 20 to buy fireworks in guernsey and there are strict restrictions on the time of year they can be sold .
gift shop owner mark passmore said the age limit should be brought more in line with other things adults can do at 18 .
at 18 , you can join the army , you can get married and have children .
so why not buy fireworks ?
i think 20 , for me , is an old antique law that needs updating . ''
author: BBC Radio Guernsey

documents.title: plan to enhance and maintain castle cornet
text: plans are being drawn up to enhance the visitor experience at guernsey 's castle cornet and maintain the centuries old fortification by the education , sport and culture committee .
the announcement was made by committee president paul le pelley .
he described the building as the jewel in guernsey 's crown and said work was expected to take five years .
author: BBC Radio Guernsey

documents.title: no frying tonight , but not all of chippy 's neighbours cry
text: a man living near to the kingfisher chip shop has expressed his dismay at its closure .
author: Guernsey Press

documents.title: new les quennevais school building approved by planners
text: plans for the new les quennevais secondary school building in st brelade have been approved by the planning committee .
the plans were unveiled earlier this year after an independent planning inspector looked at the design .
the parking arrangements have changed , and the size and scale of the school have been altered from the original plans .
st brelade politician deputy montfort tadier said it was about time the children and teachers had a school fit for purpose .
he said : `` it has not changed that much since i was a student there in the early 1990s . ''
author: BBC Radio Jersey

documents.title: st clement continue impressive premiership start
text: newly-promoted st clement continued their perfect start to the jersey premiership season with a 2-1 win in the top-of-the-table clash at st ouen .
james mccallum and matt rawlings were on target for the eastern parish side , with dom pougeolle getting the hosts ' only goal .
st clement are now five points clear of st ouen , and six ahead of champions st paul 's , who beat them 6-0 in the le riche cup first round on saturday .
author: Brent Pilnick
BBC Sport

documents.title: today 's weather : cloudy with periods of rain
text: a cloudy start to the day across the channel islands with some patchy rain .
after a few hours , dry warm weather cloud will thicken this afternoon as a band of heavy rain moves eastwards .
it will turn very windy this afternoon .
maximum temperature : 17c ( 63f ) .
jersey
guernsey
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: smaller groups might lose charity title under new rules
text: some smaller organisations in jersey may no longer be able to call themselves charities if they ca n't prove they 're for the public benefit .
it comes as part of a new charities law which proposes introducing with a public register of charities .
organisations would have to demonstrate charitable purposes and that they provided a public benefit to call themselves a charity .
charity commissioner john mills said it was currently very easy to call a group a charity in jersey .
the new system which will involve a register will be entirely transparent .
anybody who wishes to satisfy themselves of the bona fides of a charity they wish to give money to will be able to search the register at no cost to themselves . ''
author: BBC Radio Jersey

documents.title: 'uk inspector should decide ' on wayside cafe demolition
text: a jersey campaign group is unhappy with the way the environment department has handled the redevelopment of st brelade 's bay .
the st brelade 's bay association wants an independent inspector to assess plans for a restaurant and seven new homes on the site of the wayside cafe .
members of the campaign group claim the planning committee does n't have the authority to approve an application to demolish the cafe .
they said an independent uk inspector should have assessed the proposals .
the environment department said the group had misunderstood the planning process and the minister would only call for a public inquiry if the development was not in line with the island plan .
author: BBC Radio Jersey

documents.title: warning over severe wind and tides
text: people in the channel islands are being warned to expect severe gales this weekend .
guernsey coastguards said the bad weather was likely to hit on friday night and go into saturday .
coastguard head captain chad murray warned boat owners to check their moorings and said they should avoid going to sea unless it was essential as conditions could `` change very quickly '' .
guernsey met has also issued tide warnings for tonight and tomorrow night affecting the west coast .
they are expected to be more than 9m ( 30ft ) , with wind speeds of force 6-7 .
author: BBC Radio Guernsey

documents.title: states provision for podiatrists and dieticians is 'pitiful '
text: more resources are needed to support the growing number of islanders who have diabetes , according to a specialist who called states provision for dieticians and podiatrists in jersey 'pitiful ' .
author: Jersey Evening Post
